block.p: Voula Tsoutsoplides, a daughter of Aspasia Tsoutsoplides and Dr. George Tsoutsoplides of Shavertown, Pa., is to be married today to Nicholas C. Katsoris, a son of Ann Katsoris and Prof. Constantine Katsoris of Riverdale, the Bronx. The Rev. Nicholas Anctil will perform the ceremony at Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church in New Rochelle, N.Y.

The bride, 28, is a real estate lawyer at Davis & Gilbert, a law firm in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania with bachelor's degrees in international relations and French and received a law degree from Boston University. Her father is an obstetrician and gynecologist in Wilkes-Barre, Pa.

Voula Tsoutsoplides, a daughter of Aspasia Tsoutsoplides and Dr. George Tsoutsoplides of Shavertown, Pa., is to be married today to Nicholas C. Katsoris, a son of Ann Katsoris and Prof. Constantine Katsoris of Riverdale, the Bronx. The Rev. Nicholas Anctil will perform the ceremony at Holy Trinity Greek Orthodox Church in New Rochelle, N.Y.

The bride, 28, is a real estate lawyer at Davis & Gilbert, a law firm in Manhattan. She graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania with bachelor's degrees in international relations and French and received a law degree from Boston University. Her father is an obstetrician and gynecologist in Wilkes-Barre, Pa.

The bridegroom, 33, works in Manhattan as the general counsel to the Red Apple Group, whose businesses include Gristede's and Sloan's supermarkets and United Refining, an oil and gas concern. He is also the entertainment editor of The Hellenic Times, a newspaper in Manhattan, and the president of its scholarship fund for Greek-American students. He graduated cum laude from Fordham University, from which he also received a law degree. His father is the Wilkinson Professor of Law at Fordham in Manhattan, an arbitrator and a lawyer in private practice.
